definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Continue to large the volume of your mouth and breathe in a stronger flow to achieve full bending.
sentences.chinese: 压全音要继续增加口腔的空间用更强的气流来实现。

sentences.english: To get a full sound, I need times when I can ease off.
sentences.chinese: 所以，为了奏出优美的全音，我需要时间去放松。

sentences.english: The basic harmonica is a diatonic instrument.
sentences.chinese: 这种基本的口琴是一种全音的乐器。

sentences.english: The tritones are bracketed , and the derivative pentatonic scale written alongside.
sentences.chinese: 三全音被括弧起来和衍生的六音阶也加在旁边。

sentences.english: Write a whole note with SOLO above it.
sentences.chinese: 写一个全音符然后标上“独奏”就行啦。

sentences.english: The relationship of adjacent notes in all the previous scales is a whole-step or half-step.
sentences.chinese: 从以前的标准看相邻音之间的关系是一个全音或半音。

sentences.english: A twelfth part of the labour of making a plough is an appreciable quantity.
sentences.chinese: 时间量是全音符的三十二分之一的一个音乐符号。

definition: a note on a musical scale
names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
tone mark on a Chinese syllable (i.e. accents on ā á ǎ à)/(music) key signature
triad/musical chord of three notes, such as major triad do-mi-so
